note.p: Barrister. Member of the south-eastern circuit. Student of the Middle Temple, 1854. Called to the bar, 1857. Youngest son of William Micans Keogh of Dublin. Friend of Samuel James O’Hara Horsman. Charged with fraud, 1888; acquitted.
Census returns of England and Wales 1861 (The National Archives: Public Record Office RG9/181/67/1), 1871 (RG10/1315/93/24), 1881 (RG11/1354/70/22), 1891 (RG12/444/86/37)
letter from S. J. O. Horsman, 2 June [1868]
Surrey, England, calendar of prisoners, 1848–1902 (Ancestry.com, accessed 2 December 2019)
